jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

7AA07A042959431E9BD471DFB4B40166.description:
Identify how taxes benefit Catholic and
private education.

BD5D51D220AE4735AA142445C3446ABD.description:
Describe the different types of taxes
(e.g., income tax, sales tax, and
property tax).

1B84C44F77BA4F5B83E7533EC5164B6D.description:
Identify public goods and services in
the community, state, and nation.

17FC64F616D04144A2ADCF5416715C0D.description: Understand the impact of government policies and decisions on production and consumption in the economy. Understand the moral implications of policies and decisions on production and consumption. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7 (K-6 CS)       Demonstrate the ways men and societies change and/or persist over time to better understand the human condition. CSIS8 (7&8)

491FD2B9AD9C45289E3AE66F4602A6AE.description:
Explain the moral obligations involved
in the exchange of goods and services.

46EFBEA22D904ECEA7B2C86962311CF8.description:
Analyze the impact of interdependence
on the production process.

97E1C7BFA4B54FC0BCCA06EBF89B2E35.description:
Explain how division of labor creates
interdependence.

15BEA3695CB8483AACDDF22E03713C47.description:
Illustrate how division of labor in a
production process can increase
productivity.

3550C05598F748FD9B744DB218C0C4D0.description:
Predict how people's lives would be
different if they did not trade with
others for goods and services they use.

C4444C9D6F4A4E7698FE9F9521128935.description:
Identify the primary functions and
services of financial institutions.

9AFB737070DC45D69B5A0A00D5B0912D.description:
Explain the benefits of exchanging with
the use of money.

5632E206D64C47AE9222111F57BE6A7E.description: Understanding trade as an exchange of goods or services. Understand moral values behind the understanding of trade as an exchange of goods and services. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7        Value one’s own role and dignity as man in God’s plan and creation. CSGS5 (7&8)

A151F2DC621C43FAA8F657AFBE4F2D0E.description:
Describe the obligation to share
resources with all of God’s people.

55356800E96E4E20A3E90D7E64AB0C18.description:
Identify the characteristics of effective
entrepreneurs (e.g., why they are
willing to take risks to start new
businesses).

C020A363AEC748899BB730084D637B66.description:
Identify markets in which there are very
few sellers and markets in which there
are many sellers.

AFDC0F2ABE9C4E108EFDE503971AD14D.description:
Analyze why producers will produce
more goods and services at higher
prices and fewer at lower prices.

1890FD036B0C4FBB86C396A9153B6869.description:
Predict how a large increase or decrease
in the price of a good or service will
affect how much producers will make
and sell of that good or service.

67DD82AEE388427AB69C1BA7ADFB0681.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by producers. Understand that scarcity necessitates producer choices which have moral implications. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7      Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those who will come after us. CSDS2 (7-12 CS)

862E24D0C7B84FF591B2C95ED5EBB799.description:
Describe the obligation to share
resources with all of God’s people.

34D787133D7A4F1BBBE42E169910B4C1.description:
Define prices as what consumers pay
when buying goods or services and
what sellers receive when selling goods
or services.

5EA472A6E59E46ECAD47386F97EDC638.description:
Explain why consumers will buy more
goods and services at lower prices and
fewer at higher prices.

1648EE79B5564D4980CD22C781863731.description:
Describe how a large increase or
decrease in the price of a good or
service would affect how much of that
item would be purchased.

15E244BE7E7E479981917735843190A6.description:
Identify factors that affect consumer
choices (e.g., prices of goods and
services; quality; income;
preferences/tastes.

660E4065812748028FD6379A94A685E2.description:
Apply the concept of opportunity cost
to choices in the classroom.

959A0C80B4254BA2A744A1E366EC5785.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by consumers. Understand that scarcity necessitates consumer choices which have moral implications. Discriminate between what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4
Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

AD19CE7ADD8F4A53BB5456FF371876B3.description:
Discuss the moral obligation of
companies and government to treat
workers fairly.

FFA9B43962574F23B190AC03FBABD667.description:
Analyze the relationship between what
they learn in school and the skills they
need for a job.

CA90EA38FF2746B68D37003E9811E006.description:
Identify human resources in their
community and the goods and services
they produce.

089B02E15A384DA0AC93986CE888BC8D.description:
Identify the productive resources
people sell to earn income.

87F968E726054D0984A045E40169C2B4.description:
Explain how a market economy
answers the three basic economic
questions: What to produce? How to produce? For whom to produce?

515958A7DF9347208ECF00BE9A02F5A5.description:
Understand how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Understand the moral consequences of how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7 (7-12 CS)
Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions .CSIS 7 (K-6 CS)      Distinguish the religious dimensions and basic elements of Christian social ethics within historical events. CSIS19 (7& 8)

CF0EA4025CBD4D8B82CEFD9F1C37F866.description: Understand economic systems with an emphasis on the United States. Understand moral aspects of the economic systems of the United States.
